passages.text: Technology | Payments, Processors & IT services
Affirm Holdings, Inc
AFRM \(\) 80.44\(Outperform | Target Price / Base Case:\) \ \(100.00\) (from \(\) 67.00)
Change in Price Target - Earnings Report
Company StatisticsForward P/E33.9Float (M)264Shares Outstanding (M)345Market Capitalization (M)$27,672Average 5-day Volume (M)29,973Fiscal Year EndJun
1 Year Price History

Quick take: We are removing our Underperform TAP (put on prior to the call based solely on the stock's recent strength), raising our ests to slightly higher than guidance but still with room for upside, and raising our PT to \(\) 100\$

The quarter itself was really solid across the board with no material areas of weakness, and the 2026 guidance for GMV growth of \(>25\%\) easily digested the anticipated removal of Walmart volume which should roll- off this quarter. But what really stood out to us was a reminder about how many growth opportunities (from new geographies, new products, new users, etc.) have yet to be realized.

We continue to view BNPL as a compelling blend of a well- established global payment alternative with significant medium- and long- term growth potential still ahead. As noted on the call, AFRM is still well short of \(1\%\) of total US retail sales.

With core growth intact, new channels (notably AdaptAI and card) gaining scale, and profitability accelerating, we are comfortable moving to the upper end of recent valuation ranges as AFRM delivers consistent, high- quality execution. While we expect shares to remain somewhat volatile given near- term uncertainty around consumer health and spending trends, we see pullbacks as attractive buying opportunities absent any fundamental change to the story (which we don't anticipate).

- F4Q25 strength: AFRM more than justified its premium valuation with standout results — GMV up +44% YoY, well ahead of consensus; RLTC$ up +29% YoY (+8% vs. Street), driving better-than-expected RLTC margins; and adjusted EBITDA surging +58% YoY. Importantly, AFRM also delivered its first quarter of operating income profitability.- Scaling new products: Affirm Card is quickly becoming a material growth engine, deepening consumer engagement at the POS and creating a data flywheel that strengthens risk decisioning. Highlights: (1) active cardholders grew +97% YoY to 2.3M, (2) in-store card spend jumped +187% YoY, and (3) TTM spend per cardholder rose to $4,500 from $3,500. If the card expands a core use case to be what we would call a "pseudo debit-card" being used for everyday spend at the POS, Affirm's already leading risk engine gets even better. Beyond the card, other BNPL products are scaling rapidly: 0% APR volumes grew +93% YoY and Pay-in-X grew +50% YoY. Notably, 0% APR drove 50% of all new-to-Affirm users, integrating them into the ecosystem and unlocking cross-sell into higher-margin products.- RLTC tailwinds: While mix shift toward 0% APR and Pay-in-X loans pressures margins, F4Q25 brought meaningful offsets that position RLTC% to exceed the 4% target in FY26. Gain on sale of loans rose +67% YoY, fueled by ramping forward flow partnerships (e.g., Sixth Street), adding +16 bps of revenue as a % of GMV. We

expect these arrangements to continue bolstering RLTC. Funding costs improved \(- 90\) bps YoY on strong capital markets execution, with additional upside as loan demand scales and rates potentially decline. If interest rates come down as many expect, it will help drive RLTC higher but the time lag will be 12 months plus given the funding mix.

- Credit performance: Despite macro uncertainty, AFRM's credit remains resilient. 30-day delinquencies improved \(-15\) bps QoQ and \(-18\) bps YoY. With \(0\%\) APR users carrying FICO scores \(-40\) points higher than average Affirm users, we expect continued credit strength as this cohort scales.

- Geographic and vertical expansion create powerful upside levers: F4Q25 results were impressive, but we believe AFRM is far from saturating its core market. We expect US momentum to be complemented over time by international expansion into the UK and, soon, Europe — growth that is not yet reflected in guidance. At the same time, AFRM is extending into new verticals, such as airlines through its UATP partnership, broadening its addressable market and creating sustainable incremental growth vectors.

a. Report
b. Report
C. We
n. 1. Report
VALUATION METHODOLOGYOur price target is based on the NTM EV/EBITDA assumption of 30x and the NTM EV/Revenue assumption of 7.5x (50%/50% weighting), in line with Jan- Feb 2025 levels.

RISKSE key risks to our view are: (1) weaker consumer sentiment and macro data impacting underlying credit quality and translating into share price volatility, (2) slower- than- expected growth in Affirm Card, and (3) peers coming up with similar interest- bearing offering and reducing Affirm's differentiation.

Evercore ISI's recommendations are based on a stock's total forecasted return over the next 12 months. Total forecasted return is equal to the expected percentage price return plus gross dividend yield. We divide our stocks under coverage into three primary ratings categories, with the following return guidelines:

Outperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be greater than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. In Line- the total forecasted return is expected to be in line with the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. Underperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be less than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. Coverage Suspended- the rating and target price have been removed pursuant to Evercore ISI policy when Evercore is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving this company and in certain other circumstances. Rating Suspended- Evercore ISI has suspended the rating and target price for this stock because there is not sufficient fundamental basis for determining, or there are legal, regulatory or policy constraints around publishing, a rating or target price. The previous rating and target price, if any, are no longer in effect for this company and should not be relied upon.
Prior to October 10, 2015, the "Coverage Suspended" and "Rating Suspended" categories were included in the category "Suspended."

FINRA requires that members who use a ratings system with terms other than "Buy," "Hold/Neutral" and "Sell" to equate their own ratings to these categories. For this purpose, and in the Evercore ISI ratings distribution below, our Outperform, In Line, and Underperform ratings can be equated to Buy, Hold and Sell, respectively.
